meanings.def: a large, long container that you put water in and then get into to wash your whole body
an act of washing your whole body by sitting or lying in water
examples: (British English) I think I'll have a bath and go to bed.
(especially North American English) to take a bath
She took the baby upstairs to give him a bath.
When she got home she decided she needed a bath.

meanings.def: the water in a bath ready to use
examples: a long soak in a hot bath
Please run a bath for me (= fill the bath with water).
I lay soaking in a hot bubble bath.

meanings.def: a public building where you can go to swim
examples: My father took me to the baths every Sunday.

meanings.def: a public place where people went in the past to wash or have a bath
a container with a liquid such as water or a dye in it, in which something is washed or placed for a period of time. Baths are used in industrial, chemical and medical processes.
to lose money on a business agreement

idioms.def: to lose money on a business agreement

meanings.def: to give a bath to somebody
examples: It's your turn to bath the baby.
He never bathed the kids when they were little.
Let’s go for a quick swim in the pool.
She goes swimming every morning before breakfast.

meanings.def: a city in south-west England, famous for its healthy mineral water and hot springs, its ancient Roman baths and beautiful Georgian buildings. The Bath Festival is a festival of classical music held every year in May and June. In 1987 Bath was one of the first places in Britain to become a World Heritage Site.
